00104 ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::Reg ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::reg;
00105 
00106 ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine * ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00107 {
00108     if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::EngineName())
00109         return (ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine *)engine;
00110     return NULL;
00111 }
00112 
00113 ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine(
00114         ChipLayout *chipLayout,
00115         std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames) {
00116     m_a5_global_input_file = NULL;
00117     m_a5_global_input_group = NULL;
00118     m_a5_global_output_file = NULL;
00119     m_a5_global_output_group = NULL;
00120     defineStdMethods();
00121     defineOptions();
00122 
00123     if(chipLayout != NULL) {
00124       if(probesetNames == NULL)
00125           Err::errAbort("Must specify probesetNames when providing a chipLayout to ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine constructor.");
00126       m_FreeChipLayout = false;
00127       m_ChipLayout = chipLayout;
00128       m_ProbesetNames = *probesetNames;
00129     } else {
00130       m_FreeChipLayout = true;
00131       m_ChipLayout = NULL;
00132     }
00133 }
00134 
00135 ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::~ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine() {
00136 }
00137 
00138 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::defineStdMethods() {
00139     m_stdMethods["brlmm"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,brlmm.transform=ccs.K=4";
00140     m_stdMethods["brlmm-p"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,brlmm-p.CM=1.bins=100.K=2.SB=0.003.MS=0.05";
00141     m_stdMethods["brlmm-p.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,brlmm-p.CM=1.bins=100.K=2.SB=0.003.MS=1";
00142     m_stdMethods["brlmm-p-plus"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,brlmm-p.CM=1.bins=100.mix=1.bic=2.HARD=3.SB=0.45.KX=1.KH=1.5.KXX=0.5.KAH=-0.6.KHB=-0.6.transform=MVA.AAM=2.0.BBM=-2.0.AAV=0.06.BBV=0.06.ABV=0.06.copyqc=0.000001.wobble=0.05.MS=0.05";
00143     m_stdMethods["brlmm-p-plus.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,brlmm-p.CM=1.bins=100.mix=1.bic=2.HARD=3.SB=0.45.KX=1.KH=1.5.KXX=0.5.KAH=-0.6.KHB=-0.6.transform=MVA.AAM=2.0.BBM=-2.0.AAV=0.06.BBV=0.06.ABV=0.06.copyqc=0.000001.wobble=0.05.MS=1";
00144     m_stdMethods["birdseed"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,birdseed";
00145     m_stdMethods["birdseed.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,birdseed.conf-threshold=1";
00146     m_stdMethods["birdseed-v1"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,birdseed-v1";
00147     m_stdMethods["birdseed-v1.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000,pm-only,birdseed-v1.conf-threshold=1";
00148     m_stdMethods["birdseed-v2"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000.target=1000,pm-only,birdseed-v2";
00149     m_stdMethods["birdseed-v2.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000.target=1000,pm-only,birdseed-v2.conf-threshold=1";
00150     m_stdMethods["birdseed-dev"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000.target=1000,pm-only,birdseed-dev";
00151     m_stdMethods["birdseed-dev.force"] = "quant-norm.sketch=50000.target=1000,pm-only,birdseed-dev.conf-threshold=1";
00152 }

00479                      "is not set, then '/'. "
00480                      "[Experimental]",
00481                      "");
00482 
00483   defineOption("","a5-sketch-input-global",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00484                      "Read the sketch from the global A5 input file. "
00485                      "[Experimental]",
00486                      "false");
00487   defineOption("","a5-sketch-input-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00488                      "Read the sketch from the an A5 input file. "
00489                      "[Experimental]",
00490                      "");
00491   defineOption("","a5-sketch-input-group",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00492                      "Group name to read the sketch from. Defaults to --a5-input-group. "
00493                      "[Experimental]",
00494                      "");
00495   defineOption("","a5-sketch-input-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00496                      "The name of the data section. Defaults to 'target-sketch'. "
00497                      "[Experimental]",
00498                      "");
00499 
00500   defineOption("","a5-feature-effects-input-global",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00501                      "Read the feature effects global A5 input file. "
00502                      "[Experimental]",
00503                      "false");
00504   defineOption("","a5-feature-effects-input-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00505                      "Read the feature effects from the an A5 input file. "
00506                      "[Experimental]",
00507                      "");
00508   defineOption("","a5-feature-effects-input-group",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00509                      "Group name to read the feature effects from. Defaults to --a5-input-group. "
00510                      "[Experimental]",
00511                      "");
00512   defineOption("","a5-feature-effects-input-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00513                      "The name of the data section. Defaults to XXX.feature-response "
00514                      "where XXX is the analysis name and quant method. IE 'brlmm-p.plier'. "
00515                      "[Experimental]",
00516                      "");
00517 
00518   defineOption("","a5-models-input-global",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00519                      "Read the Models from the global A5 input file. "
00520                      "The tsv5 name must be 'XXX.snp-posteriors'. " // jhg
00521                      "[Experimental]",
00522                      "false");
00523   defineOption("","a5-models-input-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00524                      "Read the models from the an A5 input file. "
00525                      "[Experimental]",
00526                      "");
00527   defineOption("","a5-models-input-group",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00528                      "The group name where the models are located. Defaults to "
00529                      "the analysis name. "
00530                      "[Experimental]",
00531                      "");
00532   defineOption("","a5-models-input-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00533                      "The name of the data section. Defaults to XXX.snp-posteriors "
00534                      "where XXX is the analysis name. IE 'brlmm-p'. "
00535                      "[Experimental]",
00536                      "");
00537 
00538   defineOptionSection("Engine Options (Not used on command line)");
00539   defOptMult("", "cels", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00540                      "Cel files to process.",
00541                      "");
00542   defOptMult("", "result-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00543                      "CHP file names to output. Must be paired with cels.",
00544                      "");
00545 }
00546 
00547 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::defineStates() {
00548   defineOption("", "analysis-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00549                      "The number of user-specified analysis streams.",
00550                      "-1");
00551   defineOption("", "num-rows", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00552                      "The number of rows on the chip.",
00553                      "-1");
00554   defineOption("", "num-cols", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00555                      "The number of cols on the chip.",
00556                      "-1");
00557   defineOption("", "probe-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00558                      "The number of probes on the chip.",
00559                      "-1");
00560   defineOption("", "probeset-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00561                      "The number of probesets on the chip.",
00562                      "-1");
00563   defineOption("", "channel-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00564                      "The number of data channels in the CEL file.",
00565                      "-1");
00566   defineOption("", "need-gc", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00567                      "Do we need GC probes for the analysis.",
00568                      "false");
00569   defineOption("", "need-mismatch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00570                      "Do we need mismatch probes for the analysis.",
00571                      "false");
00572   defineOption("", "need-allelematch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00573                      "Do we need matching allele probes for the analysis.",
00574                      "false");
00575 }
00576 
00577 /**
00578  * Check the special-snp-version field in birdseed prior file. Call
00579  * Err::errAbort() if mismatch.
00580  *
00581  * @param path           - The birdseed prior file name
00582  * @param specialSnpType - The chiptype expected
00583  */
00584 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::checkBirdseedTsvPriorFile(const string &path, const string &specialSnpType) {
00585   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00586   string chip;
00587   int specialSeen = 0;
00588   if(tsv.open(path) != TSV_OK)
00589     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + path + "' to read.");
00590   bool specialSnpMatch = specialSnpType.empty(); // treat empty as wildcard
00591   while(tsv.headersFindNext("special-snp-version", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00592     specialSeen++;
00593     if(chip == specialSnpType)
00594       specialSnpMatch = true;
00595   }
00596   if(!specialSnpMatch && specialSeen > 0) {
00597     Err::errAbort( "Special Snp File: '" + specialSnpType + "' not supported by prior file: '" + path + "'.");
00598   }
00599 }
00600 
00601 /**
00602  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00603  */
00604 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::checkOptionsImp() {
00605 
00606   defineStates();
00607 
00608   setLibFileOpt("cdf-file");
00609   setLibFileOpt("spf-file");
00610   setLibFileOpt("chrX-snps");
00611   setLibFileOpt("special-snps");
00612   setLibFileOpt("chrX-probes");
00613   setLibFileOpt("chrY-probes");
00614   setLibFileOpt("probeset-ids");
00615   setLibFileOpt("probeset-ids-reported");
00616   setLibFileOpt("probe-class-file");
00617   setLibFileOpt("annotation-file");
00618   setLibFileOpt("genotype-markers-cn-file");
00619   setLibFileOpt("read-models-brlmm");
00620   setLibFileOpt("read-models-brlmmp");
00621   setLibFileOpt("read-models-birdseed");
00622   setLibFileOpt("use-feat-eff");
00623   setLibFileOpt("target-sketch");
00624   setLibFileOpt("reference-profile");
00625   setLibFileOpt("read-priors-brlmm");
00626   setLibFileOpt("kill-list");
00627   setLibFileOpt("a5-global-input-file");
00628   setLibFileOpt("a5-sketch-input-file");
00629   setLibFileOpt("a5-feature-effects-input-file");
00630   setLibFileOpt("a5-models-input-file");
00631 
00632   if(getOpt("explain") != "") { explain(); exit(0); }
00633 
00634   if (getOpt("out-dir") == "") {Err::errAbort("Must specify an output directory.");}
00635   if (getOpt("temp-dir") == "") { setOpt("temp-dir", Fs::join(getOpt("out-dir"), "temp")); }
00636 
00637   string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
00638   string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
00639   string killList = getOpt("kill-list");
00640   string specialSnps = getOpt("special-snps");
00641   string chrXSnps = getOpt("chrX-snps");
00642   string chrXProbes = getOpt("chrX-probes");
00643   string chrYProbes = getOpt("chrY-probes");
00644   vector<string> analysis = getOptVector("analysis");
00645 
00646   if(analysis.size() == 0) {
00647       analysis.push_back("brlmm");
00648       setOpt("analysis",analysis);
00649   }
00650   if(analysis.size() != 1) {
00651       Err::errAbort("Only one analysis is currently permitted.");
00652   }
00653   setOpt("analysis-count", ToStr(analysis.size()));
00654 
00655   // Check that a global file was given if the user wants global a5 output
00656   if(getOpt("a5-global-file") == "") {
00657       vector<string> optionNames;
00658       getOptionNames(optionNames);
00659       for(size_t i=0; i<optionNames.size(); i++) {
00660           string name = optionNames[i];
00661           if( name.find("use-global") != name.npos ) {
00662               if( getOptBool(name) ) {
00663                   Err::errAbort("--" + name + " option given, but no global file. Must specify --a5-global-file.");
00664               }
00665           }
00666       }
00667   }
00668   // Check that a global input file was given if the user wants global a5 input
00669   if(getOpt("a5-global-input-file") == "") {
00670       vector<string> optionNames;
00671       getOptionNames(optionNames);
00672       for(size_t i=0; i<optionNames.size(); i++) {
00673           string name = optionNames[i];
00674           if( name.find("input-global") != name.npos ) {
00675               if( getOptBool(name) ){
00676                   Err::errAbort("--" + name + " option given, but no global input file. Must specify --a5-global-input-file.");
00677               }
00678           }
00679       }
00680   }
00681   // make sure global input and output files are different
00682   if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") == getOpt("a5-global-file"))
00683       if(getOpt("a5-global-input-file") != "")
00684           Err::errAbort("Unable to use the same A5 file for global input and output.");
00685 
00686   /* Read in cel file list from other file if specified. */
00687   vector<string> celFiles;
00688   EngineUtil::getCelFiles(celFiles, this);
00689   if(celFiles.size() == 0)
00690       Err::errAbort("No cel files specified.");
00691   setOpt("cels",celFiles);
00692 
00693 
00694   vector<string> resultFiles = getOptVector("result-files");
00695   if(resultFiles.size() > 0) {
00696       if(celFiles.size() != resultFiles.size())
00697         Err::errAbort("result-files option used but is not the same size as cel file listing");
00698       bool ccOut = getOptBool("cc-chp-output");
00699       bool xdaOut = getOptBool("xda-chp-output");
00700       if(ccOut && xdaOut) 
00701           Err::errAbort("cannot use multiple CHP output formats with the result-files option");
00702   }
00703 
00704   // If we're doing birdseed or brlmm-p we can save space by not loading the mismatch and gc mappings.
00705   bool needGc = false, needMisMatch = false, needAlleleMatch = false;
00706   for(size_t aIx = 0; aIx < analysis.size(); aIx++) {
00707       ///@todo would be nice to query AnalysisStreamFactory for this info
00708       string analysisName = analysis[aIx];
00709       map<string,string>::iterator iter;
00710       for(iter = m_stdMethods.begin(); iter != m_stdMethods.end(); iter++) {
00711           if(iter->first == analysisName) {
00712               analysisName = iter->second;
00713           }
00714       }
00715       if(analysis[aIx].find("pm-mm") != string::npos)
00716           needMisMatch = true;
00717       if(analysis[aIx].find("pm-gcbg") != string::npos)
00718           needGc = true;
00719       if(analysis[aIx].find("gc-bg") != string::npos)
00720           needGc = true;
00721       if(analysis[aIx].find("pm-sum") != string::npos)
00722           needAlleleMatch = true;
00723 
00724       ///@todo need to deal with DM listener, setting needMisMatch appropriately
00725       ///      this is a crude hack to get this. There may be cases where DM 
00726       ///      listener is run even though brlmm was not selected (and cases where
00727       ///      brlmm is run but DM seeds are not used).
00728       if(analysis[aIx].find(",brlmm.") != string::npos)
00729           needMisMatch = true;
00730   }
00731   setOpt("need-gc", ToStr(needGc));
00732   setOpt("need-mismatch",ToStr(needMisMatch));
00733   setOpt("need-allelematch",ToStr(needAlleleMatch));
00734 
00735   if(cdfFile == "" && spfFile == "") {
00736     Err::errAbort("Must specify either a cdf file or spf (simple probe format) file.");
00737   }
00738   if(killList != "" && cdfFile == "") {
00739     Err::errAbort("'--kill-list-file' option only supported on cdf files.");
00740    }
00741   if((chrXSnps  == "") && (specialSnps == "") && ((chrXProbes == "") || (chrYProbes == "")) && (getOpt("read-genders") == "") && !getOptBool("no-gender-force")) {
00742     Err::errAbort("Have to specify chrX snps, haploid snps, chrX/Y probe file, or a gender file in order to generate genders for genotype calling. Use the --no-gender-force option to force genotype calling.");
00743   }
00744   if(killList != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00745     Err::errAbort("Can't specify a kill list and XDA CHP output at same time.");
00746   }
00747   if(killList != "" && getOptBool("cc-chp-output")) {
00748     Err::errAbort("Can't specify a kill list and CC CHP output at same time.");
00749   }
00750   if (chrXProbes != "" && chrYProbes == "") {
00751     Err::errAbort("Must provide a chrY Probe File when providing a chrX Probe File.");
00752   }
00753   if (chrXProbes == "" && chrYProbes != "") {
00754     Err::errAbort("Must provide a chrX Probe File when providing a chrY Probe File.");
00755   }
00756   if(getOpt("probeset-ids") != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00757     Err::errAbort("Can't specify a subset and XDA CHP output at same time. Must use all probesets for CHP file output.");
00758   }
00759   if(getOpt("probeset-ids-reported") != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00760     Err::errAbort("Can't specify a reporting subset and XDA CHP output at same time. Must use all probesets for CHP file output.");
00761   }
00762   if(getOpt("probeset-ids-reported") != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00763     Err::errAbort("Can't specify a reporting subset and AGCC CHP output at same time. Must use all probesets for CHP file output.");
00764   }
00765 
00766   if(getOptBool("list-sample") && getOpt("probeset-ids") == "") {
00767     Err::errAbort("Can't set listSample without specifying a probeset-ids file.");
00768   }
00769 
00770   /* Some sanity checks. */
00771   if(analysis.empty())
00772       Err::errAbort("Must specify at least one analysis to preform.");
00773 
00774   if ((getOptInt("prior-size") == 0) &&
00775       (getOpt("read-priors-brlmm") == "")) {
00776     setOpt("prior-size", ToStr(10000)); // our default value.
00777   } else {
00778     setOpt("prior-size", getOpt("prior-size")); // our default value.
00779   }
00780   int numProbesets = 0;
00781   if(cdfFile != "") {
00782     /* Check to make sure that we aren't using more probesets for prior than are available. */
00783     ///@todo should have a similar check for spf input
00784     affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCDFData cdf;
00785     cdf.SetFileName(cdfFile.c_str());
00786     if(!cdf.ReadHeader()) {
00787       Err::errAbort("Can't read header for " + cdfFile + ". Description: " + cdf.GetError());
00788     }
00789     affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdf.GetHeader();
00790     numProbesets = cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets();
00791     if ((numProbesets < getOptInt("prior-size")) &&
00792         getOpt("read-priors-brlmm") == "") {
00793       Err::errAbort("Can't have size of prior: " + ToStr(getOptInt("prior-size")) +
00794                     " larger than number of probesets: " + ToStr(numProbesets));
00795     }
00796     cdf.Close();
00797   }
00798   /// @todo fix hack for discriminating snp5 vs snp6
00799   ///       aw: propose fix where we only allow xda chp output for
00800   ///           a specific set of chip types. Anything else is not
00801   ///           allowed.
00802   /* cws: If probesets are greater than 300K it has to be snp5
00803      or snp6 which shouldn't be used with xda format, has to be a
00804      better way to do this though... */
00805   if(numProbesets > 300000 && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00806     Err::errAbort("Can't make XDA style probesets with newer chips, use --cc-chp-output instead to get new format chp files.");
00807   }
00808 
00809   // special SNPs 
00810   bool needSpecialSnps = false;
00811   for(size_t aIx = 0; aIx < analysis.size(); aIx++) {
00812     if(analysis[aIx].find("birdseed") != string::npos) {
00813       needSpecialSnps = true;
00814       if ((getOpt("read-models-birdseed") == "")) {
00815         Err::errAbort("Birdseed requires models with '--read-models-birdseed'.");
00816       }
00817     }
00818   }
00819   if ((chrXSnps != "") && needSpecialSnps)
00820      Err::errAbort("Must use --special-snps rather than --chrX-snps when using birdseed "
00821                    "as birdseed expects chrY snps.");
00822   if ((specialSnps == "") && needSpecialSnps)
00823     Err::errAbort("Must specify '--special-snps' when special SNPS are needed.");
00824 
00825   // Check chip types
00826   vector<string> chipTypesInLayout;
00827 
00828   /* Get the intial info about the chip and check cel files to make sure
00829      they match. */
00830   colrow_t numRows = 0, numCols = 0;
00831   int probeCount = 0, probeSetCount=0, channelCount = 1;
00832 
00833   // Get channel count from first CEL file.
00834   affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData cel;  
00835   try {
00836     if(!(Fs::fileExists(celFiles[0].c_str()))) {
00837       Err::errAbort("File: " + celFiles[0] + " doesn't appear to exist.");
00838       
00839     }
00840     cel.SetFileName(celFiles[0].c_str());
00841     if(!cel.Read()) 
00842       Err::errAbort("\nCan't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + 
00843                     "\n>>> Error reported: " + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetError()));
00844   }
00845   catch(const Except &e) {
00846     Err::errAbort("Error opening cel file: " + celFiles[0] + " error message is: " + e.what());
00847   }
00848   catch(...) {
00849     Err::errAbort("Error opening cel file: " + celFiles[0]);
00850   }
00851 
00852   // If this is a AGCC CEL file, then get channels.  If this is a GCOS
00853   // CEL file, then an empty vector is returned.
00854   std::vector<std::wstring> data_channels = cel.GetChannels();
00855   if (!data_channels.empty()) {
00856     channelCount = data_channels.size();
00857   }
00858 
00859   if (cdfFile != "") {
00860     EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypesInLayout, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, cdfFile);
00861   }
00862   else if (spfFile != "") {
00863     EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypesInLayout, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, spfFile);
00864   }
00865   else {
00866     Err::errAbort("Must specify either a cdf file or spf (simple probe format) file.");
00867   }
00868 
00869   setOpt("num-rows", ToStr(numRows));
00870   setOpt("num-cols", ToStr(numCols));
00871   setOpt("probe-count", ToStr(probeCount));
00872   setOpt("probeset-count", ToStr(probeSetCount));
00873   setOpt("channel-count", ToStr(channelCount));
00874 
00875   if(chipTypesInLayout.empty() || chipTypesInLayout[0] == "" || probeCount == 0) 
00876       Err::errAbort("Problem determining ChipType in file: " + 
00877               ( cdfFile != "" ? cdfFile : spfFile));
00878 
00879   /* Did the user "force" a set of chip types via options? */
00880   vector<string> chipTypesSupplied = getOptVector("chip-type");
00881 
00882   /* Figure out what chip type to report */
00883   if(chipTypesSupplied.size() > 0) {
00884       setOpt("chip-type", chipTypesSupplied[0]);
00885   } else if(chipTypesInLayout.size() > 0) {
00886       setOpt("chip-type", chipTypesInLayout[0]);
00887   } else {
00888       Err::errAbort("Unable to figure out a chip type.");
00889   }
00890 
00891   /* Do Chip Type Check */
00892   if(!getOptBool("force")) {
00893     vector<string> chipTypesToCheck;
00894 
00895     if(chipTypesSupplied.size() > 0) {
00896         chipTypesToCheck = chipTypesSupplied;
00897         EngineUtil::checkChipTypeVectors(chipTypesSupplied, chipTypesInLayout);
00898     } else {
00899         chipTypesToCheck = chipTypesInLayout;
00900     }
00901 
00902     EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypesToCheck, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00903 
00904     // Check model files
00905     // We only check the first (primary) chip type.
00906     // This ensures that model files for foo.cdf
00907     // but not foo.bar.cdf will fail the check
00908     if (getOpt("read-models-birdseed") != "") {
00909         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(getOpt("read-models-birdseed"), chipTypesToCheck);
00910         checkBirdseedTsvPriorFile(getOpt("read-models-birdseed"), "");
00911     }
00912     if (getOpt("read-models-brlmm") != "") {
00913         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(getOpt("read-models-brlmm"), chipTypesToCheck);
00914     }
00915     if (getOpt("read-models-brlmmp") != "") {
00916         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(getOpt("read-models-brlmmp"), chipTypesToCheck);
00917     }
00918     
00919     // Check prior files
00920     ///@todo check prior files chip type -- not tested
00921     //if (getOpt("read-priors-brlmm") != "") {
00922     //    EngineUtil:: checkTsvFileChipType(getOpt("read-priors-brlmm"), chipTypesToCheck);
00923     //}
00924     
00925     // Check special SNPs files
00926     if (specialSnps != "") {
00927         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(specialSnps, chipTypesToCheck);
00928     }
00929     if (chrXSnps != "") {
00930         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(chrXSnps, chipTypesToCheck);
00931     }
00932     
00933     // And other files
00934     if (getOpt("probe-class-file") != "") {
00935         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(getOpt("probe-class-file"), chipTypesToCheck);
00936     }
00937     if (chrXProbes != "") {
00938         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(chrXProbes, chipTypesToCheck);
00939     }
00940     if (chrYProbes != "") {
00941         EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(chrYProbes, chipTypesToCheck);
00942     }
00943   }
00944 
00945   if(!Fs::isWriteableDir(getOpt("out-dir")))
00946     if(Fs::mkdirPath(getOpt("out-dir"), false) != APT_OK)
00947       APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + getOpt("out-dir"));
00948   
00949   makeTempDir(getOpt("temp-dir"));
00950 }
00951 
00952 /**
00953  * @brief checks if there is enough disk space for diskmarts in the
00954  * temp-dir and for chp files in out-dir
00955  */
00956 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::checkDiskSpaceImp() {
00957   int64_t out_disk_available = -1, scratch_disk_available = -1;
00958   int cel_count = getOptVector("cels").size();
00959   int probeset_count = getOptInt("probeset-count");
00960   //  int row_count = getOptInt("num-rows");
00961   //  int col_count = getOptInt("num-cols");
00962   //  int channel_count = getOptInt("channel-count");
00963   //  int analysis_stream_count = getOptInt("analysis-count");
00964   
00965   std::vector<std::string> result_files = getOptVector("result-files");
00966 
00967   FsPath out_path;
00968   if (!result_files.empty()) {
00969     FsPath tmp_path(result_files[0]);
00970     if (tmp_path.getDirName()=="") {
00971       out_path.setDirName(tmp_path.getDirName());
00972     }
00973     // @todo iterate through all of the result dirs to check available disk space
00974   }
00975 
00976   if (out_path.empty()) {
00977     out_path.setDirName(getOpt("cc-chp-out-dir"));
00978   }
00979   if (out_path.empty()) {
00980     out_path.setDirName(getOpt("out-dir"));
00981   }
00982 
00983   out_disk_available = out_path.getFreeDiskSpace();
00984 
00985   uint64_t out_disk_needed = 0;  
00986   if (getOptBool("cc-chp-output")) {
00987     // @todo - why 35.49? CS
00988     out_disk_needed = static_cast<uint64_t>(probeset_count) * cel_count * 35.49;
00989   }
00990   
00991   // (1 + analysis_stream_count): one initial raw diskmart + one diskmart for
00992   // each analysis stream
00993   uint64_t scratch_disk_needed = 0;
00994 
00995   FsPath tempdir_path;
00996   tempdir_path.setDirName(getOpt("temp-dir"));
00997 
00998   bool same_vol = tempdir_path.isSameVolume(out_path);
00999   if (tempdir_path.empty() ||
01000       (same_vol==true) ||
01001       (tempdir_path == out_path)) {
01002     out_disk_needed += scratch_disk_needed;
01003   }
01004   else {
01005     scratch_disk_available = tempdir_path.getFreeDiskSpace();
01006     if (scratch_disk_needed > 0 && 
01007         scratch_disk_available >= 0 &&
01008         scratch_disk_needed >= scratch_disk_available) {
01009       // format in kb
01010       scratch_disk_needed = (scratch_disk_needed + 512) / 1024;
01011       scratch_disk_available = (scratch_disk_available + 512) / 1024;
01012       Err::errAbort("In " + tempdir_path.asString() + ", need " +
01013                     ToStr(scratch_disk_needed) + "kb of scratch diskspace. "
01014                     "Only " + ToStr(scratch_disk_available) + "kb available.");
01015     }
01016   }
01017 
01018   if (out_disk_needed > 0 &&
01019       out_disk_available >= 0 &&
01020       out_disk_needed >= out_disk_available) {
01021     // format in kb
01022     out_disk_needed = (out_disk_needed + 512) / 1024;
01023     out_disk_available = (out_disk_available + 512) / 1024;
01024     Err::errAbort("In " + out_path.asString() + ", need " + ToStr(out_disk_needed) + "kb of diskspace. "
01025                   "Only " + ToStr(out_disk_available) + "kb available.");
01026   }
01027 }
01028   
01029 /*   For copynumber chp files, the formula is */
01030 /* 42.08 * num_probesets_processed */
01031 
01032 /**
01033  * @brief Get a list from a text file to select a subset of probe sets for
01034  * analysis.
01035  *
01036  * @param fileName - Path to file for reading probe subset from.
01037  * @param vNames - vector of probeset names
01038  * @param sNames - set of probeset names
01039  */
01040 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::loadPSFile(const std::string &fileName,
01041                         std::vector<const char *> *vNames,
01042                         std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *sNames) {
01043   affx::TsvFile tsv;
01044   std::string probeset;
01045   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01046   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
01047     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + fileName + " to read.");
01048   int psCount = 0;
01049   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
01050     if(vNames != NULL)
01051         vNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(probeset.c_str()));
01052     if(sNames != NULL) {
01053         if(vNames != NULL)
01054             sNames->insert(vNames->at(psCount));
01055         else
01056             sNames->insert(Util::cloneString(probeset.c_str()));
01057     }
01058     psCount++;
01059   }
01060   tsv.close();
01061 }
01062 
01063 /**
01064  * Read the design of the chip from the cdf or spf file.
01065  *
01066  * @param layout        - Object to be filled in.
01067  * @param probesetNames - Vector of probeset names to be filled in
01068  * @param killList      - Vector of probes to ignore
01069  * @param justStats     - Boolean indicating whether we want to keep probe layout info
01070  * @param  psTypesToLoad - What probeset types to load
01071  */
01072 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::loadLayout(ChipLayout &layout,
01073                    std::vector<const char *> &probesetNames,
01074                    probeidmap_t &killList,
01075                    bool justStats,
01076                    std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad) {
01077 
01078   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad;
01079   vector<string> requiredCols;
01080 
01081   string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
01082   string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
01083   int computePrior = getOptInt("prior-size");
01084   bool listSample = getOptBool("list-sample");
01085 
01086   ///@todo populate probeSetsToLoad -- right now we are simply loading everything
01087 
01088   /* If we are sampling for a prior we need to load up all of the
01089      probesets, so empty the set which indicates this to openCdf(). */
01090   if(computePrior > 0 && !listSample) {
01091     probeSetsToLoad.clear();
01092   }
01093 
01094   vector<bool> probeSubset;  //leave empty as we simply load everything
01095 
01096   try {
01097     if(cdfFile != "") {
01098       Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening layout file: ") + cdfFile);
01099       if(!layout.openCdf(       cdfFile, 
01100                                 probeSetsToLoad, 
01101                                 &probesetNames,
01102                                 probeSubset, 
01103                                 "", 
01104                                 killList, 
01105                                 justStats, 
01106                                 psTypesToLoad)) {
01107         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open layout file: " + cdfFile);
01108       }
01109     }
01110     else if(spfFile != "") {
01111       Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening layout file: ") + spfFile);
01112       layout.openSpf(spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, &probesetNames, probeSubset,
01113                            "", justStats, psTypesToLoad);
01114     }
01115     else {
01116       Err::errAbort("Must have either a cdf file or spf file.");
01117     }
01118   }
01119   catch(const Except &e) {
01120     Err::errAbort(e.what());
01121   }
01122   catch(...) {
01123     Err::errAbort("Unknown exception caught - terminating.");
01124   }
01125   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(probesetNames.size()) + " probesets.");
01126 }
01127 
01128 /**
01129  * Open a text file and read in snps that are possibly haploid. Currently
01130  * only chrX snps are supported.
01131  *
01132  * @param SpecialSnps -
01133  * @param layout      -
01134  * @param permissive  -
01135  */
01136 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::fillInSpecialSnps(SpecialSnpMap &SpecialSnps,
01137                        ChipLayout &layout, bool permissive) {
01138   std::string specialType, chip;
01139 
01140   string specialSnps = getOpt("special-snps");
01141 
01142   readSpecialSnpsFile(&SpecialSnps, &chip, &specialType, specialSnps);
01143 
01144   // check the chip type
01145   affx::TsvFile tsv;
01146   string snpName;
01147   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &snpName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01148   /* sanity checks */
01149   if(tsv.open(specialSnps) != TSV_OK)
01150     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + specialSnps + " to read.");
01151   tsv.close();
01152 
01153   // make sure the SNP in the specialSnps file is also in CDF
01154   if (!permissive) {
01155       for (SpecialSnpMap::const_iterator it = SpecialSnps.begin();
01156            it != SpecialSnps.end(); ++it) {
01157           const string &snpName = (*it).first;
01158           if (!layout.containsProbeSet(snpName)) {
01159               Err::errAbort("Can't find special snp: " + snpName + " in cdf file. Wrong special snp file?");
01160           }
01161       }
01162   }
01163 }
01164 
01165 
01166 
01167 /**
01168  * Read the prior from a file or generate one from the data.
01169  *
01170  * @param outFile - File to output prior if desired.
01171  * @param sample - Vector of probesets to generate prior from, if using data.
01172  * @param layout - Grouping and location of probesets.
01173  * @param iMart - Intensity mart of data for generating prior.
01174  * @param chipStream - Vector of modification objects to pass raw data through.
01175  * @param pmAdjuster - Probe specific adjustment.
01176  * @param qBRLMM - Quantification method for calling snps.
01177  */
01178 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::setPrior(string &outFile, vector<string> &sample,
01179               ChipLayout &layout, IntensityMart &iMart,
01180               vector<ChipStream *> &chipStream, PmAdjuster &pmAdjuster,
01181               QuantBRLMM *qBRLMM) {
01182   if(getOpt("read-priors-brlmm") != "") {
01183     Verbose::out(1, "Loading priors from: " + getOpt("read-priors-brlmm") );
01184     ClusterPrior prior = QuantBRLMM::loadPrior(getOpt("read-priors-brlmm"));
01185     if(getOptBool("write-prior")) {
01186       QuantBRLMM::writePrior(prior, outFile);
01187     }
01188     qBRLMM->setPrior(prior);
01189   }
01190   else if(getOptInt("prior-size") > 0) {
01191     Verbose::out(1, "Computing prior with: " + ToStr(sample.size()) + " initial snps.");
01192     ClusterPrior prior = qBRLMM->makePrior(sample, layout, iMart, chipStream, pmAdjuster);
01193     if(prior.snpCount < 10) {
01194       Err::errAbort(ToStr("Only ") + ToStr(prior.snpCount) +
01195                     " SNP clusters had enough information to generate prior. Please try using more cel files.");
01196     }
01197     Verbose::out(1, ToStr(prior.snpCount) + " SNP clusters used to generate prior.");
01198     if(getOptBool("write-prior")) {
01199       QuantBRLMM::writePrior(prior, outFile);
01200     }
01201     qBRLMM->setPrior(prior);
01202   }
01203 }
01204 
01205 /**
01206  * Make covariate normalizations from a file or generate one from the data.
01207  *
01208  * @param outFile - File to output normalization parameters if desired.
01209  * @param sample - Vector of probesets to generate normalizations from, if using data.
01210  * @param layout - Grouping and location of probesets.
01211  * @param iMart - Intensity mart of data for generating normalizers.
01212  * @param chipStream - Vector of modification objects to pass raw data through.
01213  * @param pmAdjuster - Probe specific adjustment.
01214  * @param qLabelZ - Quantification method for calling snps.
01215  */
01216 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::setNormLabelZ(string &outFile, vector<std::string> sample,
01217                    ChipLayout &layout, IntensityMart &iMart,
01218                    vector<ChipStream *> &chipStream, PmAdjuster &pmAdjuster,
01219                    QuantLabelZ *qLabelZ) {
01220   if(getOptInt("norm-size") > 0) {
01221     Verbose::out(1, "Computing normalizer with: " + ToStr(sample.size()) + " initial snps.");
01222     // here's where we do the magic
01223     // take the sample of snps
01224     // build a normalizer map of normalization across samples
01225     // 1 normalization predictor per sample
01226     vector<NormalizationPredictor> normMap = qLabelZ->makeNorm(sample, layout, iMart,
01227                                                                chipStream, pmAdjuster);
01228     if(getOptBool("write-norm")) {
01229       QuantLabelZ::writeNormMap(normMap, outFile);
01230     }
01231     qLabelZ->setNorm(normMap);
01232   }
01233 }

01235 /**
01236  * Construct an object for output that contains the program an
01237  * algorithm information.
01238  * @param as - AnalysisStream to get information from.
01239  * @param layout - Layout to get information from.
01240  * @param probesetNames - List of probeset names to output
01241  *
01242  * @return - Information for making CHP file.
01243  */
01244 AnalysisInfo ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::makeAnalysisInfo(AnalysisStream *as,
01245                               ChipLayout &layout,
01246                               const std::vector<const char*> &probesetNames,
01247                               GenderCalls *genders) {
01248 
01249   AnalysisInfo info;
01250   info.m_MaxPsNameLength = layout.getMaxNameLength();
01251   info.m_NumExpression = layout.getNumExpressionPSets();
01252   info.m_NumGenotyping = layout.getNumGenotypeingPSets();
01253   info.m_NumReporting = layout.getProbeSetCount();
01254   info.m_NumRows = layout.getXCount();
01255   info.m_NumCols = layout.getYCount();
01256   info.m_NumProbeSets = probesetNames.size();
01257   info.m_ProbeSetType = affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType;
01258   fillInAnalysisInfo(info, as);
01259 
01260   QuantGTypeMethod *method =
01261       dynamic_cast<QuantGTypeMethod *>(as->getQuantMethod());
01262   float min = method->getMinThresh();
01263   info.addParam("min-thresh",ToStr(min));
01264   float max = method->getMaxThresh();
01265   info.addParam("max-thresh",ToStr(max));
01266 
01267   info.addParam("gender_method_used",genders->getGenderName());
01268 
01269   // this is a "magic" value that works with GCOS/GTYPE according to Richard
01270   info.m_ProgID = "GDMTAnalysis.BRMBaseCall.1";
01271 
01272   // If CHP Output, then we need list of probeset names to output
01273   // Otherwise do not waste the memory
01274   if(getOptBool("cc-chp-output") || getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) 
01275     info.m_ProbesetNames = probesetNames;
01276 
01277   // Sanity check
01278   Err::check(info.m_ParamValues.size() == info.m_ParamNames.size(),
01279              "AnalysisInfo - Names and values out of sync.");
01280   return info;
01281 }
01282 
01283 void ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::fillInAnalysisInfo(AnalysisInfo &info, QuantMethod *qMethod) {
01284     info.m_AlgVersion = qMethod->getVersion();
01285     //    info.m_AlgName = as->getName();
01286     //    info.addParam(prefix + "analysis-guid", as->getGuid());
01287     info.addParam("quantification-name", qMethod->getType());
01288     info.addParam("quantification-version", qMethod->getVersion());
01289     //    info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "analysis-name", as->getName());
01290 
01291     info.addParam("quantification-scale", QuantMethod::scaleToTxt(qMethod->getScale()));
01292     info.addParam("quantification-type", QuantMethod::quantTypeToTxt(qMethod->getQuantType()));
01293 
01294 }

01297     ///@todo need to refactor to ensure consistency between meta info tracked in probeset-summarize

01310     info.m_AnalysisGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
01311

01314     info.addParam(prefix + "program-name", getOpt("program-name"));
01315     info.addParam(prefix + "command-line", getOpt("command-line"));
01316     info.addParam(prefix + "exec-guid", getOpt("exec-guid"));
01317

01319     info.addParam(prefix + "version", getOpt("version-to-report"));
01320     info.addParam(prefix + "cvs-id", getOpt("program-cvs-id"));

01322     ///@todo add other state:
01323     ///@todo time-end state
01324 
01325     // Engine Options
01326     std::string subprefix = "opt-";
01327     // no do-ps-names

01335     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "xda-chp-out-dir", getOpt("xda-chp-out-dir"));

01337     // no spf-file 
01338     // no pgf-file

01340     // no bgp-file

01342     // no meta-ps-file
01343     // no-qc-groups-file
01344     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "kill-list",      Fs::basename(getOpt("kill-list")));
01345     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "temp-dir", getOpt("temp-dir"));
01346     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "use-disk", getOpt("use-disk"));
01347     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "diskCache", getOpt("disk-cache"));
01348     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "cel-count", ToStr(celFiles.size()));
01349     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < celFiles.size(); i++) {
01350       std::string paramName = prefix + subprefix + "cel-" + ToStr(i+1);
01351       info.addParam(paramName, Fs::basename(celFiles[i]));
01352     }
01353 
01354     // Algorithm Options
01355     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "analysis-name", info.m_AlgName);
01356     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "set-analysis-name", getOpt("set-analysis-name"));
01357     //    info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "set-analysis-name", getOpt("set-analysis-name"));

01360     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "target-sketch-file", Fs::basename(getOpt("target-sketch")));
01361     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "reference-profile-file",Fs::basename(getOpt("reference-profile")));
01362     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "do-residuals", getOpt("feat-details"));
01363     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "do-feature-effects", getOpt("feat-effects"));
01364     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "write-sketch", getOpt("write-sketch"));
01365     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "write-profile",getOpt("write-profile"));
01366

01368     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "set-gender-method", getOpt("set-gender-method"));
01369     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "chrXProbeFile", Fs::basename(getOpt("chrX-probes")));
01370     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "chrYProbeFile", Fs::basename(getOpt("chrY-probes")));

01379     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "special-snps", Fs::basename(getOpt("special-snps")));
01380     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "compute-prior", ToStr(getOptInt("prior-size")));
01381     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "norm-size", getOpt("norm-size"));
01382     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "dm-thresh", getOpt("dm-thresh"));
01383     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "dm-het-mult", getOpt("dm-hetmult"));
01384     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "read-genders",        Fs::basename(getOpt("read-genders")));
01385     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "read-inbred",         Fs::basename(getOpt("read-inbred")));
01386     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "model-file-brlmm"   , Fs::basename(getOpt("read-models-brlmm")));
01387     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "model-file-brlmmp"  , Fs::basename(getOpt("read-models-brlmmp")));
01388     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "model-file-birdseed", Fs::basename(getOpt("read-models-birdseed")));
01389     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "genotypes-file"     , Fs::basename(getOpt("genotypes")));
01390     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "dm-calls-out", getOpt("dm-out"));
01391     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "qmethod-spec", getOpt("qmethod-spec"));
01392     info.addParam(prefix + subprefix + "genotype-only", ToStr(!getOptBool("all-types")));
01393 
01394     // Quantification Related Meta Info
01395     // Add user defined meta data parameters
01396     vector<pair<string, string> > metaData = getMetaDataDescription();
01397     for (int i = 0; i < metaData.size(); i++) {
01398       pair<string,string> p = metaData[i];
01399       info.addClientMetaInfo(p.first, p.second);
01400     }
01401 }

01413 AnalysisInfo ProbesetGenotypeStageEngine::makeAnalysisInfo(

01416                                                            GenderCalls *genders,
01417                                                            const std::string &analysisName) {

01421   info.m_NumExpression = layout.getNumExpressionPSets();
01422   info.m_NumGenotyping = layout.getNumGenotypeingPSets();
01423   info.m_NumReporting = layout.getNumGenotypeingPSets();

01428   info.m_NumProbeSets = layout.getProbeSetCount(); //probesetNames.size();
01429   info.m_ProbeSetType = affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType;
01430   // @todo refactor - what is output prefix?
01431   fillInAnalysisInfo(info, "apt-");
01432 
01433   // @todo refactor - make this work
01434   // QuantGTypeMethod *method =
01435   //     dynamic_cast<QuantGTypeMethod *>(as->getQuantMethod());
01436   // float min = method->getMinThresh();
01437   // info.addParam("min-thresh",ToStr(min));
01438   // float max = method->getMaxThresh();
01439   // info.addParam("max-thresh",ToStr(max));
01440 
01441   info.addParam("gender_method_used",genders->getGenderName());
01442 
01443   // this is a "magic" value that works with GCOS/GTYPE according to Richard
01444   info.m_ProgID = "GDMTAnalysis.BRMBaseCall.1";
01445 
01446   // If CHP Output, then we need list of probeset names to output
01447   // Otherwise do not waste the memory
01448   if(getOptBool("cc-chp-output") || getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) 
01449     info.m_ProbesetNames = probesetNames;
01450 
01451   // Sanity check
01452   Err::check(info.m_ParamValues.size() == info.m_ParamNames.size(),
01453              "AnalysisInfo - Names and values out of sync.");
01454   return info;
01455 }
